definition: come without a shadow, leave without a footprint (idiom); to come and leave without a trace
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: Second, this is a subtle, sneaky virus.
sentences.chinese: 第二，这是一种难以捉摸的，来去无踪的病毒。

sentences.english: Boys and girls like it when the soul of a daze, erratic, to come and go without a trace.
sentences.chinese: 它就像少男少女发呆时的灵魂，飘忽不定，来去无踪。

definition: lit. come without a shadow, leave without a footprint (idiom); to come and go without a trace
pinyin: lai2 wu2 ying3 , qu4 wu2 zong1

definition: lit. to appear and disappear unpredictably like a spirit or a ghost (idiom)/fig. elusive
to possess great magical power/to possess remarkable abilities
lit. to go up to heaven or down to Hades (idiom)/fig. to go to great lengths/to search heaven and earth
pose or motion of one's body in martial arts
to leap onto roofs and vault over walls (usually associated with martial arts)
deceitful in many ways (idiom); wily and mischievous/full of craft and cunning
